description: TypeScript implementation scaffold for a pipeline with _meta folder at implementation level.

version.description: Pipeline version identifier (not necessarily semver). Examples: v1, 2024-10-01

author.description: GitHub organization or user handle (kebab-case). Used for linking and avatars.

implementation.description: Implementation name nested under the language folder (kebab-case). Defaults to 'default'.

packageName.description: npm package name for the pipeline helpers (use @workspace/ prefix if publishing in this monorepo).

children.name: pipeline.json
children.template:
{
  "$schema": "https://schemas.connector-factory.dev/pipeline.schema.json",
  "identifier": "{pipeline}",
  "name": "{pipeline}",
  "author": "{author}",
  "authorType": "organization",
  "version": "{version}",
  "language": "typescript",
  "implementation": "{implementation}",
  "description": "",
  "tags": [],
  "schedule": { "cron": "0 * * * *", "timezone": "UTC" },
  "source": { "type": "connector", "connector": { "name": "", "version": "", "author": "" }, "stream": "" },
  "systems": [],
  "transformations": [],
  "destination": { "system": "clickhouse", "database": "", "table": "" },
  "lineage": { "nodes": [], "edges": [] },
  "maintainers": [],
  "registryUrl": "https://github.com/514-labs/registry/tree/main/pipeline-registry/{pipeline}/{version}/{author}/typescript/{implementation}"
}

children.name: README.md
CHANGELOG.md
children.template:
# Changelog

All notable changes to `{pipeline}` TypeScript {implementation} implementation by `{author}`.

## [0.1.0] - Initial Release

- Initial pipeline implementation

children.name: LICENSE
children.template: MIT

children.name: README.md
children.template: Place the source system logo here as 'logo.png' (or .svg/.jpg/.jpeg/.webp).

children.name: README.md
children.template: Place the destination system logo here as 'logo.png' (or .svg/.jpg/.jpeg/.webp).

children.name: .gitignore
children.template:
node_modules/
dist/
.env

children.name: ENV.EXAMPLE
children.template:
# Example environment variables for the pipeline implementation
API_KEY=

children.name: README.md
children.template:
# {pipeline} (TypeScript)

TypeScript helpers for the `{pipeline}` pipeline by `{author}`.

- See `schemas/index.json` for optional machine-readable dataset definitions and accompanying Markdown docs.
- Maintain lineage in `moose/lineage.manifest.json` and optionally under `lineage/schemas`.

children.name: package.json
tsconfig.json
vitest.config.ts
children.template:
import { defineConfig } from 'vitest/config'
export default defineConfig({ test: { environment: 'node' } })

children.name: getting-started.md
children.template:
# Getting started

Document how to configure and operate this pipeline implementation.

children.name: configuration.md
children.template:
# Configuration

Document configuration options (auth, scopes, IDs, destinations).

children.name: outputs.md
children.template:
# Outputs

Describe pipeline outputs (datasets/tables) and link to `schemas/index.json` if used.

lineage.manifest.json
index.json
tables.json
README.md
children.template:
# Lineage Relational Schemas

Tables produced by the pipeline after transformations.

children.name: manifest.json
README.md
children.template:
# Lineage Files

File outputs from the pipeline (CSV/JSON/Parquet/etc).

children.name: index.ts
children.template:
export * from './runner'
export * from './config'

children.name: runner.ts
config.ts
children.template: export type PipelineConfig = { schedule?: { cron: string; timezone?: string } }

children.name: baseExtractor.ts
baseTransformer.ts
baseLoader.ts
{resource}Models.ts
{resource}Transforms.ts
{resource}Workflow.ts
aurora.config.toml
children.template:
# Aurora configuration for {pipeline} pipeline
[aurora]
name = "{pipeline}"
version = "{version}"

children.name: moose.config.toml
children.template:
# Moose configuration for {pipeline} pipeline
[moose]
name = "{pipeline}"
version = "{version}"

initial-setup.sh
basic-usage.ts

import { PipelineRunner } from './src/runner'
console.log(new PipelineRunner({}).ping())
